channel.title: blender on Home
channel.description: Recent content in blender on Home

item.title: Installing Blender manually in Linux
item.description: Sometimes the package manager does not give you the lastest version of the software. This guide shows you how to install Blender manually without the use of package manager in order to get the lastest version. I am using Ubuntu in this example. Download the zip file from Blender website. Unzip the file. Copy the extracted folder to somewhere else if you want to. For me I placed them in /opt folder.
